result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

20CF295, 21CF434 and 22CF232.  10:10 AM Defendant Joeseph Paul Brown in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Joeseph Paul Brown.  JP-Clerk.    Atty Larimore puts resolution of 20CF295 and 21CF434 on the record.  DE pleads G to Count 1 on file 20CF295.  Ct finds DE FVI&K enters plea, finds DE G and enters J.  Remaining counts on 20CF295 RID w/o prej and w/o costs.  21CF434 is RI&D w/o prej and w/o costs.  22CF232 will be scheduled for a 2 day JT w/#1 analyst.  20CF295 will tag along for a status.  22CF232 - witness lists, pretrial motions, MIL, etc 30 days prior to trial.  Sentencing on file 20CF295 will happen at end of JT.  Bond continues.  10:25 adj.

2:29 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Joeseph Paul Brown in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Joeseph Paul Brown. State calls Deputy Adam Morine - S&T. State takes JN of bonds in 20CF295 & 21CF434. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Larimore. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. 2:53 pm adj.
Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
